lead_paragraph: Pakistan closed a vital supply route for the war in Afghanistan on Thursday in apparent retaliation for a NATO helicopter attack on a Pakistani security post.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Pakistan closed a vital supply route for the war in Afghanistan on Thursday in apparent retaliation for a NATO helicopter attack on a Pakistani security post.

headline.main: Signaling Tensions, Pakistan Shuts NATO Route
headline.print_headline: PAKISTANI DEATHS IN U.S. AIRSTRIKE STRAIN RELATIONS

byline.original: By JANE PERLEZ and HELENE COOPER
byline.contributor: Jane Perlez reported from Islamabad, Pakistan, and Helene Cooper from Washington. Ismail Khan contributed reporting from Peshawar, Pakistan; Eric Schmitt from Washington; and Alissa J. Rubin from Kabul, Afghanistan.
